{"step_by_step_thinking": "Clinical supervision is a practice that is used to ensure the quality of care and improve the skills of healthcare professionals. It involves a more experienced professional providing guidance and feedback to a less experienced one. This can help to sustain the workforce by improving job satisfaction, reducing burnout, and improving the quality of care. However, it is not the only factor that can sustain the workforce in the current healthcare landscape. Other factors such as adequate pay, good working conditions, and opportunities for advancement are also important. Therefore, while clinical supervision can contribute to sustaining the workforce, it cannot do so alone.", "answer_choice": "C. maybe"}
